title: Haider
summary: William Shakespeare's Hamlet is reimagined in mid 90's Kashmir.
critic_reviews: Some of the filmâ€™s most effective moments are masterful in their visual storytelling skill.
Though the political backdrop often overwhelms or distorts the family drama, Mr. Bhardwaj provides the occasional sharp reminder of how cinematically he can construct Shakespearean moments.
It makes the text feel newly alive, bristly, radical. A palpable hit, in any language.

reviews.content: I think with this Movie .....Hindi cinema has reached a whole new heights.....with character depths and  effervescent and unfathomable display of acting skills by the Masters ( Tabu , Key Key and Shahid "Haider" Kapoor....... I was leftI think with this Movie .....Hindi cinema has reached a whole new heights.....with character depths and  effervescent and unfathomable display of acting skills by the Masters ( Tabu , Key Key and Shahid "Haider" Kapoor....... I was left awestruck to see this beautiful adaptation......I made me feel Think , Feel , Love and Hate the characters in the movie......One word to sum up ..... Impeccable

As a Bollywood movie it is above average, well, a good one! But as it is an adaption of William Shakespeare's drama it failed to reach the excellence. Some unnecessary comedy scenes and songs would, perhaps, have made it a better movie.

This movie proves that Bollywood have high standard. It's a pack of thrill and drama together. Shahid Kapoor and Tabu are at their best. Vishal Bharadwaj is undoubtedly one of the top directors of the world.
